definition: to turn (a corner etc)/to kidnap/to swindle/to misappropriate/walking stick/crutch/seven (used as a substitute for 七[qi1])
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
turning point/breaking point/inflexion point (math., a point of a curve at which the curvature changes sign)
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
human trafficking/to abduct and sell/to kidnap and sell
lit. going round the curves and skirting the corners (idiom)/fig. to speak in a roundabout way/to equivocate/to beat about the bush
Shiguai district of Baotou city 包頭市|包头市[Bao1 tou2 shi4], Inner Mongolia
see 李鐵拐|李铁拐[Li3 Tie3 guai3]

sentences.english: Go down the street till the crossroads and turn left there.
sentences.chinese: 沿着這條路走到十字路口，向左拐。

sentences.english: Follow the main road until it branches, and then turn to the right.
sentences.chinese: 順著這條大路走，在路的分岔口向右拐。

sentences.english: To the left side, then come to the right side.
sentences.chinese: 到左邊去了，那就趕緊往右拐。

sentences.english: The car made a sharp curve.
Take the first turning on [to] the left.
sentences.chinese: 在第一個拐彎處向左拐。

sentences.english: Take the first turning on the right and then ask again.
sentences.chinese: 到第一橫馬路往右拐，然後再問一下。

sentences.english: Jeff had just turned left down a dirt road.
sentences.chinese: 傑夫將車向左拐上了一條土路。

sentences.english: Turn left there and you will see Chang'an Avenue.
sentences.chinese: 在那兒向左拐，你就會看到長安街了。

sentences.english: Turn right at the end of Bridge Street into Riverside Road.
sentences.chinese: 在橋街的盡頭向右拐，進入濱河路。

sentences.english: The car turned left at the corner and disappeared from our view.
sentences.chinese: 汽車在拐角處向左拐，然後就從我們的視線中消失了。

sentences.english: You is this turning curved son to say that I grow it's not good-looking?
sentences.chinese: 你這是拐着彎子說我長得不好看？

sentences.english: Go down Center Street and turn left.
sentences.chinese: 沿着中央大街走然後向左拐。

sentences.english: So far, it has rescued more than 100 trafficked children.
sentences.chinese: 迄今爲止已經解救了100多名被拐兒童。

sentences.english: About three hundred yards farther on there is a turning to the left.
sentences.chinese: 再往前大約300碼有一個向左拐的拐角。

sentences.english: Go straight along this road. Then go over the bridge and turn right at the bookshop.
sentences.chinese: 沿着這條路直走，過橋後，在書店處右拐。

definition: to bend/bent/a bend/a turn (in the road etc)/CL:道[dao4]
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
erhua variant of 拐彎|拐弯[guai3 wan1]
meandering and circuitous (idiom); to go around in circles and never get anywhere
to step on/to tread on/to wear (shoes)/(slang) to dump (sb)/Taiwan pr. [deng4]
